title.narrative: Muuni Wauchembere Wabwino/ Maternal Health Alliance Project (MHAP)

description.narrative: To broadly develop applicable strategies and methodologies for systematically improving implementation of evidence based maternal and neonatal health to maximise reduction in maternal and neonatal deaths and mothers to child HIV transmission.

"Develop broadly applicable strategies, tools, approaches and methodologies for systematically improving implementation of evidence-based maternal/newborn health (MNCH) and HIV strategies to maximize reductions in maternal and newborn deaths and maternal to child transmission of HIV infection."
CARE is collaborating with others on the development of fast and flexible methods to improve the science of implementation and to share learning for rapid scale up. As part of this collaboration, we hope to demonstrate the value of working together in Malawi on a maternal and newborn health implementation science project.
An all inclusive approach involving all players, from an ordinary citizen at grass root to policy makers at higher level through creating negotiation spaces for right holders, duty bearers and other key stakeholders

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
